message.content:
cs.DB, cs.HCI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses the integration of spreadsheets, notebooks, and relational databases for data curation, which falls under the domain of database systems (cs.DB). The focus on ease of exception and idiosyncratic manual transformations suggests a human-computer interaction (cs.HCI) perspective. The use of declarative languages and specialized techniques for data repair suggests information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG) techniques may be involved. Finally, the proposal of a new system for data curation suggests software engineering (cs.SE) considerations.
